product_name: Good MoleculesPure Cold-Pressed Rosehip Seed Oil
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackPromote a bright, plump complexion with Pure Cold-Pressed Rosehip Seed Oil from Good Molecules.
details: DetailsBenefitsRosehip Seed Oil contains antioxidants such as Vitamin A and C to help fight the signs of aging.Sourced from sustainably grown & hand-picked rose hips in Southern Chile using fair-trade practices.Item 2583061How To UseWarm a few drops between palms and gently press into damp skin. Use as the last step in your routine or under moisturizer. Suitable for daily use.IngredientsRosa Rubiginosa (Rosehip) Seed Oil.
how_to_use: Warm a few drops between palms and gently press into damp skin. Use as the last step in your routine or under moisturizer. Suitable for daily use.

reviews.headline: great for sensitive skin and flare-ups!
reviews.comments: this is one of my go-to's! not just for regular use (extra moisturizing in general, night moisturizer, locking in moisturizing lotions/serums, etc), but for when my super-sensitive, overreactive skin is experiencing a flare-up (or to help heal a bad reaction from another product)! works and absorbs better than other brands, and also doesn't go bad nearly as quickly as other brands.

reviews.headline: JUST BUY IT!
reviews.comments: Rashy redness and uneven skintone be gone!  This facial oil has made my skin look flawless! Its amazing! I put it on right behind the toner.  Good Molecules brings results.

reviews.headline: Helps with angry inflammation
reviews.comments: As I have crossed over into my 30's noticed that I have been getting some angry acne, redness and inflammation. I use this to help after I've cleansed my face etc. Best used for me at night time. The next day my skin look better and healthy.

reviews.headline: I never get tired of raving about this oil.
reviews.comments: My skin has never appeared nor felt more smooth.

reviews.headline: Feels nice on skin
reviews.comments: A good oil if you are dealing with drier skin. Nice feel on the skin, not too heavy.

reviews.headline: The product I've been missing
reviews.comments: I use tretenoin which is very drying, and I have sensitive skin. Ive been mixing a couple drops of this oil with my moisturizer morning and night and its amazing how much happier my skin is, in the middle of winter! It is so gently hydrating, my skin is plump and happy. Its an antioxidant, too.

reviews.headline: My skin loves it
reviews.comments: So when I initially bought this oil, I was going to use it as my last step in my skincare routine.  But, watching a video on YT I decided to try it a different way. I mix it with an essence and put this on before my moisturizer and it has been a game changer.

reviews.headline: Rosehip Seed Oil
reviews.comments: This oil is very hydrating and smells nice , however , i dont think its for my sensitive skin girlies !! it breaks me out every time !! :((

reviews.headline: It's okay
reviews.comments: It does keep my face moist. But I don't know, if I would buy it again.

reviews.headline: Adding this to my monthly Ilya trip!
reviews.comments: Leaves my skin sooo bright, moisturized, and helps to keep acne GONE.

reviews.headline: What a difference
reviews.comments: I recently bought this to use with my Gua Sha routine and WOW. I'm 38 with maturing skin and I have some wrinkles starting on my forehead and after the first use they were noticeably less visible. My skin is brighter, plumper, and softer too. Absolutely love this product!

reviews.headline: One of my favorite rebuys
reviews.comments: I have rebought this oil many times and I will continue to buy it. I have combo skin that leans more one way, depending on the time of year. This oil helps to comfort my skin and leaves it smooth. I use it as the final step of my routine and it's a must for gua sha. Do remember to warm it up between your hands to get it as thin as possible. I enjoy the smell, it's a little earthy and nutty but you won't smell it once it's on your skin.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product Again.
reviews.comments: This product worked well to mix in to my MAX Eyeliner to soften it when it got hard.

reviews.headline: My holy grail
reviews.comments:
Best rose hip oil on market. Great product 
Price point unbelievable 
Works so well on my 70ish year old skin

reviews.headline: Not For Everyone
reviews.comments: A lot of people seemed really stoked with their results after trying this product. Unfortunately it didnt seem to sit well with my skin. I tried to give it some time to give it a chance but it just broke me out. Not normal surface breakout but it was painful inder the skin breakout. Just be careful with new products

reviews.headline: Now part of my skincare ritual
reviews.comments: I love it!! It keeps my skin glowing!!

reviews.headline: Cherry on top .
reviews.comments: Does just what's needed after cleaning and hydrating this gives that extra gloo. Face feels more firm, smoother ,even, and a shade lighter .

reviews.headline: Winter must have
reviews.comments: this has been my saving grace from below freezing temperatures wrecking havoc on my face

reviews.headline: I love this!!
reviews.comments: I love this serum so much. My skin does not feel oily but it does feel clean and moisturized. Would DEFINITELY recommend

reviews.headline: Love this brand!
reviews.comments:
This is my second bottle and a must have!
I use other items from Good Molecules and they don't disappoint.

media.headline: Such a cute & small product BUT
Such a cute & small product BUT

faceoff_positive.comments:
I only use cold pressed rosehip oil to moisturize my face, because it's what I've found works best for my combination skin. It balances things out after a couple weeks of using religiously, and only takes 4-5 drops to cover an entire face. If anyone is confused about how to apply serums…start with 4-5 drops in your fingertips, rub them together (fingertips only) for just a couple seconds, then begin tapping your fingertips all over your face randomly. This evenly distributes the product before rubbing it in all over. Afterward, go ahead and press it in gently, with the palms of your clean hands. 
I have tried many brands of rosehip seed oil, and this one absorbs the best without looking or feeling heavy like some others can (as long as it's applied properly). The Baukucha oil blends by Good Molecule are nice also, but did not show results like this pure rosehip seed version for my personal skin.
I have dark / medium 32yo skin depending on the season, and this is incredible for keeping any dark spots evened out, or diminished all together; no breakouts from using this…ever. 
I use a Niacinamide serum underneath, and a rosewater toner to finish. Keeps my skin glowing, bouncy, and hydrated all year round. Can't live without the Rosehip seed serum or Niacinamide from Good Molecules.
faceoff_positive.headline: Can't live without

faceoff_negative.comments: I am very disappointed with my purchase to say the least. I have used this oil until it is a little over halfway gone, and it is now to late to return. Since the first day this product had a fishy smell (exactly like fish oil) and I simply shrugged it off. I continued using it on my hair, eyebrows, and eyelashes with a decieving impression that was inspiring hair growth, which it is supposed to do because of its antioxidants and vitamins. This morning I got utterly fed up with the scent and looked up why it smelled so bad. The answer I got was if your rosehip oil smells like fish then it has gone rancid, and that it is supposed to have a mild earthy or nutty scent. I am very angry and upset. I don't have that much money to spend on beauty supplies, and deeply regret my decision to spend any money on this product. I have learned my lesson to not purchase any more of Good Molecule's products for the fear of getting another spoiled, bacteria-infested item.
faceoff_negative.headline: Disappointed
